website_summaries.verdict: If you like the convenience of a wrist BP monitor, this easy-to-use device with multiple features and great performance could be for you.
pros: Monitor automatically inflates when you are in position
Informative BP bar compares your results to "normal" range
cons: Not suitable for those with very large wrists

customer_reviews.title: Great meter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the older version of the same model. It is VERY quiet to the point that you may not realize it is working. It also is meant to be used with your arm lifted at an angle instead of holding it across your chest like the old one. This takes getting used to if you used the old one a lot like my wife, but works just as good if not better.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: Needs additional work
customer_reviews.text: It is simple to use; however the readings may vary based on you using it correctly. This may mean positioned correctly, holding your arm up high enough, and sometimes I feel like it’s simply random. I wasn’t feeling well at one point and couldn’t sit up well. My readings were horrible during that time. I compared this to a traditional cuff on my arm. I don’t like the inconsistencies, especially knowing that many people may read it wrong and have more risk than they are aware of.
customer_reviews.author: BizMom

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate readings. 2 consecutive readings may be +-15. Returned and got same brand conventional upper arm device. Discussed with the doctor, he said that wrist monitors are only for those, who can't fit the regular arm cuffs.
customer_reviews.author: Meow

customer_reviews.title: BP taking & recording  made easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good BP wrist cup. It was recommended by my Doctor, who said she had no stock in this brand. I had a slight issue getting it linked to my phone, but 1 simple call to Ormon and I was walked right through it. Heres the thing theres a bluetooth button on the right side in the back. This seems to be w ok rking very good for me. Taking BP & transferring info to my phone. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but no backlight
customer_reviews.text: Omron Model 6350. Well made, light weight, easy to apply, easy to activate. Excellent for a general appreciation of your blood pressure, but it my be off by a few points. For accuracy, one is always better off having the monitor calibrated against a doctor office’s. Cuff monitors are not as accurate as upper arm monitors. The 6350 serves me well, as I am monitoring changes in blood pressure between lying down and standing up. My one big disappointment is that in order to prolong battery life, the manufacturer chose not to backlight the screen, which means you cannot use in while in bed in a darkened room. Made in Vietnam.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Rózsa

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent readings
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to use and connect to the Omron app. However that's about where I draw the line at positive things to say about the device. I was disappointed that my readings were actually always super low which I know to be inaccurate considering I have HBP although controlled on medication its rarely as low as the device suggested. Plus I compared it with my arm cuff and the doctors office it was off/lower by 20-30 sys and 10-20 dys . I will be looking at other products to have a portable bp machine.
customer_reviews.author: ashclark_25

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BP monitor for the money with great benefits and ease of operation
customer_reviews.text: I never give any product a perfect rating. Okay well, rarely... you get my point. I have to check my BP 2x daily. The monitor tells you when you are in the correct position, takes your pressures with no fuss or pain. Tells you when your pressures are high based on standard AHA guidelines. Easy transfer from monitor to app on your phone. As of now haven't had to give this report to my cardiologist, but will certainly update this review when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Crews

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Not!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with dead batteries. Monitor never would pair with my iPhone 11 bluetooth. Cheap and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ARMYGUY

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt work as I expected from omron it gives false numbers with an ERROR message and u have to keep trying it several times. I have an order version that works alot better
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Alsaiyad

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth the money -- will be returning it
customer_reviews.text: It was a bear to set up, and its readings didn't come close to any other BP machines I compared it with.
customer_reviews.author: Jane B.

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: This unit is described as being able to store information for two users and transmit it to their phones over blue tooth. IT DOES NOT! You must send each reading separately to the persons phone that is using it at the time. It does NOT keep readings separate by user. This is worthless for two users. The advertising verbiage is totally misleading. I sent support 8 or 10 questions by e-mail about this and never received a response. Finally had to call them to find out how it really worked.
customer_reviews.author: SparkWizard

customer_reviews.title: looks ok, works terrible
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product, It's awkward to use, hand cuff was too long, sicking out about 5 inch from wrist like the third hand, hampering movement. Measuring process was obscure, compress and decompress randomly occurred. I have another Omeron 5 series , last 10 yrs or so, still better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Use daily
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to be able to sync with iPhone. Easy to use otherwise. Do wish the screen was backlit. Overall, a good choice for daily monitoring of blood pressure
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: This does not work properly 241/114 ?? Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking product, but does not work. 241/114 ?? Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Jedi D

customer_reviews.title: This device is a royal PITA!
customer_reviews.text: Canned response about problems. Had it since February and bluetooth connectivity sucks. Sometimes it will connect and then you have to re-try, time and time again. This BP monitor will put your health at risk for not connecting. I sent all my BP readings to my doctor for her to read, no good if I can't connect to the device. Device MFG is useless for helping out and I am demanding a refund. DO BUY THIS DEVICE!
customer_reviews.author: Twit

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and needed.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a wrist BP unit. I went with this company due to I have bought 3 of the arm cuff BP units and had great results. Due to the pressure on my upper arm hurting so bad a number of years ago I gotten a wrist BP I was using and became concerned that my numbers were high.. Went to doctor office and they said the old wrist BP unit (not this brand) was not reading correct and suggested getting a replacement. As I have always trusted the upper arm cuff of this brand I looked for a wrist unit. Easy to set up and happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: joyce nelson

customer_reviews.title: Accurate . easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great . Took to my doctors office to compare with other blood pressure monitor. Was accurate . Easy to use. With App downloaded to my smart phone I am able to track my blood pressure .
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Wrist vs Cuff no statistical difference
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised in comparing Omron/ Rite Aid meters sytolic (avg=133/132, StdDev=15/14) and, diastolic (avg74/66, StdDev=7/7) & pulse (57/57,StdDev 6/6) for n= 84 tests on each meter were not statistically different. I did find w/both 1st systolic readings were high, the Omron more so. The blue heart lite is good to level meter with your heart. Omron will avg 3 individual readings, but not take them automatically. It is quite sensitive, tensing or most any movement, giving Error msg. It will serve for "on the go" meter, if I stand still.
customer_reviews.author: notBert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Due to a health condition, a regular blood pressure cuff ranges from very uncomfortable to painful during use. Also, trying to get the regular cuff on correctly with one hand is a PITA. The combo was frustrating and made it difficult to take my BP several times a day and keep track of it for my doctor. This wrist cuff is perfect for me.... MUCH easier to put on correctly with one hand. The pressure at my wrist is more bearable. My doctor is happy that I am happy and not moaning about hard it is to track my BP for her.
customer_reviews.author: Impera Magna

customer_reviews.title: Plastic piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this monitor. It’s lightweight, flimsy and cheaply made. Shocked to see such a sub par item from Omron. Save your money and pass on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy in a smaller package!
customer_reviews.text: I have two blood pressure cuffs that are used above the elbow and I did not realize how cumbersome they were until I tried the wrist cuff. I took it to my Doctor’s office to check for accuracy and it was spot on! This takes up almost no room so easy to travel with So size is an added plus! Omron is a trusted brand for blood pressure monitoring and this wrist cuff lives up to their reputation!
customer_reviews.author: Bevh

customer_reviews.title: It seems nice.
customer_reviews.text: This product is recommended to morbidly obese patients that are actively trying to make life changes. The problem is that the cuff does not fit many ones wrists. Now you do have some ones people with smaller wrists that this may help, but good luck to the rest!
customer_reviews.author: Zalee's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to get going, is quick and give good readings. I had ordered (and returned) the iProven version of this product because unfortunately I had not read the reviews. The iProven required battery replacement after just 3 uses and their were multiple reviews stating that was a problem. I have not had an issue with this product and batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: This looks nice and is fairly easy to put on but is inaccurate. I took it to my doctor's office yesterday to compare it and it was way too high. 177/100 was one reading. I tried it several times and on both wrists but it was always way higher than what the doctor took with the regular blood pressure cuff. Don't waste your money. It is useless.
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse taking blood pressures on 29 residents. I took readings with this Omron and with a coworkers Walmart Equate brand and continuously got different and higher readings. Even on myself it would get high readings (174/102). I'm sorry I invested money in this product. (Note: I am completely satisfied with my Omron HEM-712C and was hoping for the same with the wrist monitor.)
customer_reviews.author: MYSTUFF

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price, bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to see that a piece of medical equipment was shipped in a padded envelope. Luckily inside the crushed box, the product is ensconced in a hard plastic case—which I am certain saved it. It is easy to set up and use. I have an arm one, but couldn’t tolerate the inflation, so am looking forward to using this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bookwoman1019

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER 3 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Originally it worked great. Within 3 months it stopped working; changed the batteries, worked again for 2 weeks and stopped again. I AM TIRED OF GETTING PRODUCTS VIA AMAZON THAT DON'T WORK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I AM TIRED OF SPENDING MY HARD EARNED MONEY ON CRAP THAT DOES NOT DO WHAT IT CLAIMS IT WILL DO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the accuracy of this BP monitor. It has its own small case which protects it in my purse or luggage, and is very portable. Fits my needs exactly!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Stay up to date with your daily blood pressure readings
customer_reviews.text: Recently diagnosed with high blood pressure so started my diet and meds and purchased this digital wrist pulse meter and its awesome and so easy to use with great accuracy, very happy with product
customer_reviews.author: Angel L Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: accuracy zero. Same positions same time more than 30 unit difference . Buy large one for arm
customer_reviews.author: Ramin

customer_reviews.title: Essential for every home.
customer_reviews.text: Its very helpful during this time. I am pregnant with low bp and this device has helped me a lot to check and maintain my blood pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY RECOMMEND. GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor works great. Very accurate, and has reminders sent to your phone to take your BP and Meds.
customer_reviews.author: CECI ALBA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easily syncs with the Kardia app. provided quick easy reading
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE ONE when you need accuracy, speed and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Omron unit I have owned. The first one failed after about three years. I used it about 6 to 10 times every 24 hours. This blood pressure monitor is very accurate as compared to a unit from the same manufacturer but slightly different model which my doctor's office uses. It is important that I take my blood pressure often as it fluctuates greatly at times. This unit is very easy to use and it I were to buy another one it would be this brand and model.
customer_reviews.author: GeoPhoto.

customer_reviews.title: Great meter - Accurate & easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to position correctly - silent air pump - accurate when compared to Dr office - Bluetooth to OMRON CONNECT app works well. Easy to download data to Excel spreadsheet. a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: GerryG

customer_reviews.title: Questionable accuracy. Not sure.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. Very easy to use. Silent. Have not compared with that of Doctors office. Compared to another BP device my blood pressure shows lower. As a result I don't know how accurate it is.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Wrist monitor
customer_reviews.text: Had to get wrist monitor cuz they don’t Have large arm cuff monitors wrist monitors easier n comfortable not sure of accuracy tho.
customer_reviews.author: ALEJANDRA

customer_reviews.title: numbers are hard to see
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this monitor. I have had an older one for several years that is very easy to read. This one is horrible.The numbers show an outline behind your blood pressure measurement & has to be turned a certain way to see it. Cheaply made. Do not buy this. The display numbers are very dull.
customer_reviews.author: GJ2017

customer_reviews.title: ONRON 7 SERIES WIRELESS  WRIST BLOOD PRESSURE MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: USED WITH A REGULAR ARM MONITOR TO CK ACCURACY AND IT WAS THE SAME. SO IT WORKS DRS DON'T THINK SO BUT THEY R WRONG.
customer_reviews.author: judi

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Readings are all over the place for myself and others. A Magic 8 Ball would be more useful. Save your money. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Did not give an accurate reading. It kept reading around 90 over 60. Went to the doctor and my reading was 120/90!!!! Haven't found a wrist monitor that is accurate yet.
customer_reviews.author: VRD

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Was accurate with the one in my doctors office. Nice small case and fits in my purse easily.
customer_reviews.author: sharon schmidt

customer_reviews.title: technology
customer_reviews.text: accuracy will only come from a sphygmonometer, but if used right every time its almost 95% right
customer_reviews.author: shana brown

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: It errors more than it works. The slightest movement messes it up. I’ve had better luck with cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: N. Eller

customer_reviews.title: Works well most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: This machine works well most of the time but I have AFIB and seem to go in and out of it. When I am in Arrhythmia it is nearly impossible to get a reading, I keep getting an E4 error ("You moved or talked during a measurement"). I can try several times but keep getting the same message regardless of how still I set.
customer_reviews.author: Russell R Raupp

customer_reviews.title: Portability is important to us.
customer_reviews.text: We can use this anywhere and not having to worry about where to plug it in. Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Totally inaccurate. Took mine to the doctor to compare readings. Systolic read 30 points below doctor's reading. Good thing I wasn't using it for health reasons. Oh wait, I was!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Plushner

customer_reviews.title: Really good monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This brand for wrist always works well. Only one i buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Me

customer_reviews.title: Under Pressure
customer_reviews.text: I have to take my pressure 3 times in a row to get a believable value. I don't know if my sitting position is wrong or this thing just has a mind of its own but the 1st reading is always ridiculously high.
customer_reviews.author: Cherbear40

customer_reviews.title: Really great! And syncs with iphone!
customer_reviews.text: Greally great BP cuff. Super easy to use, and syncs with iphone health. A+
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Impressed RN
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nurse and was a bit skeptical about a wrist measurement... I calibrated this Omron device against my manual sphygmomanometer and the numbers were practically identical... I’m very very impressed with this BP cuff!
customer_reviews.author: PEB

customer_reviews.title: This item was NOT ordered.
customer_reviews.text: ..it is a 'duplicate'....i did order the 'Gold ' Model shown below
customer_reviews.author: kibble

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to accurate. Just took my BP and it read 75/50 ..... A good reading for me is 130/80. Total waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sheltiemom

customer_reviews.title: ease of operation
customer_reviews.text: very small and quiet, difficult to pair with blue tooth
customer_reviews.author: Joe B. Reuss

customer_reviews.title: Love it 😻
customer_reviews.text: My second time purchasing this product absolutely satisfied. I bought the insurance this time :) as a nurse much needed in a busy setting.
customer_reviews.author: ALEXIS

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work every night. Amazing! Better then the equipment provided to us.
customer_reviews.author: BriAnna Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Way off in accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Way off. My cardiologist said to return it and get arm cuff one instead. Readings were way off, too high.
customer_reviews.author: James Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not worht for your money
customer_reviews.text: It does not work, I downloaded the omron app and cant find the Bluetooth device I assumed maybe my phone was not good I tried different phones Bluetooth not working, it looks cheap and does not give accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: Hakan Cayci

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to use vs, arm B.P. cuff.
customer_reviews.text: More comfortable and easier to use than the arm B.P. cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: It’s very convenient and easy to read. Once you get the hang of positioning your arm correctly it’s very easy. Comes in a convenient travel case!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: No Lighed Face
customer_reviews.text: We liked the product except that the face is not lit and my 93 year old Mom can't see it... Unfortunately we must return it...
customer_reviews.author: D Moran

customer_reviews.title: Easy blood pressure monitoring
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use monitor. Much more convenient to use than an upper arm cuff monitor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! It takes a measurement no matter what! It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sara_Teeny_Teemmy’s_Maaam

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for few weeks. now showing incorrect reading and couple of functionalities not working.
customer_reviews.author: chintan

customer_reviews.title: Service was Great
customer_reviews.text: Got the BP cuff a day after I placed the order. Easy to use. Quite pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Lou White

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use and accurate, I’ve compared to taking manually and it’s spot on
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate readings
customer_reviews.text: The readings are inaccurate and fluctuate too much for medical professionals
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: I  like that Amazon supplies brands like Omron!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for daily blood pressure readings. Great to have such a fine product!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wildly Inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst products I have ever purchased ( no exaggeration). First warning sign upon opening package is big red warning card -STOP BEFORE RETURNING-( ominous start) until you seek help! Apparently many returns of this item. Readings are way, way off! As far as the bluetooth connection, it doesn't work at all! Card didn't work, I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: not made in Japan, lacks testing
customer_reviews.text: waste of peoples time. Three people tried to get this thing to work It was DOA. Morever, the brain dead marketing department back in Tokyo has never amended nor updated the instruction manual that tells you to download an OMRON app. The app never worked. Always returns an error message. It was probably that way for years. Who knows. Hey OMRON, wake up! You used to be an admirable company.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Tin-tin

customer_reviews.title: My mom AND her nurse never figured it out
customer_reviews.text: My mom AND her in home nurse could not figure out how to get this to work. That is bad. I feel bad for having picked it out for her! She is embarrassed to return things but I don't like paying for stuff that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: BASIL

customer_reviews.title: Error messages
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the instructions for pairing the unit with my iPad were incorrect. Had to call Omron and got help from them. Error message E4 just about every time I tried to use it. Screen disappears after 5 seconds.Very disappointed and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kali's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity almost non-existent
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. It's quiet and easy to read and use. However, I bought this because it said it had Bluetooth connectivity, which it doesn't, or if it does I could not connect after 7 tries. I am keeping it only because it is quiet and my husband is using our other Omron wrist band. I suggest you do not purchase if you are looking for a device that has blue tooth connectivity. I will need to continue recording my blood pressure on my Excel spreadsheet.
customer_reviews.author: CeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I tried many wrist monitors but have found Omron the most accurate. I replaced an older 8 year old Omron with this one. Advances in technology are obvious. This one is slimmer and totally silent with a faster read time. It also is packed in a slim case which fits in a pocket. Battery access is easy. Bluetooth is nice. Note-the bluetooth pair button is on the back. It is worth paying more for quality.
customer_reviews.author: NorthghostTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use except Bluetooth needs time to sync. Many say wrist measurements are inaccurate but that's mostly due to the user. You must be careful to be in the correct position and with wrist BP, there is more room for error since the elbow is bent while with an upper arm BP, the forearm is allow to rest. Keep the same position, I am able to obtain repeatable results which match measurements taken by other means.
customer_reviews.author: mia

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS READ FINE PRINT FOR TECH PRODUCTS!!
customer_reviews.text: Not easy for Non Tech Savvy Folks! Also VERY Difficult to Read Monitor! Not a lighted screen. Isn’t compatible with iPhoneX... found out after the fact. It does say select however doesn’t refer to see OMRON Website in the general description on Amazon. Had to re-read the whole Amazon info before seeing the suggestion to go to Website as per Sellers answer in the Questions area. Returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine A

customer_reviews.title: I love this B/P monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is the third b/p cuff monitor I've ordered from Amazon. The first two were terrible --very cheaply made with the instruction booklet written in very poor English. First two did not work properly. Item description was not accurate. Both made in China. Amazon refunded. me for both. This time I looked for one not made in China. The Omron 7 cuff monitor is wonderful. Easy to use, everything works. It is not flimsy or cheaply made. Made in Japan. I've learnt my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: maryanne laffin

customer_reviews.title: Best wrist monitor in 2020
customer_reviews.text: This is small and silent; the battery compartment is easy to access. Directions are a bit sparse and you do need to know how to take an accurate reading (rest for five minutes sitting or laying still before starting it). It is very comfortable to use. The Omron smartphone app is very intrusive, wanting to grab all your medical data and send it overseas for marketing reasons, but it can set the time and date on the monitor automatically. Lie outrageously when setting up the app and then delete it from your phone after you have the time and date set. The app is *not* necessary to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: T. O.

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like it was reading high so I took it to my doctor for comparison. The reading was consistently 41mm/hg too high for systolic and diastolic, so I returned the unit. Doc says most wrist monitors are not very accurate but Omron is a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr O

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure I'm happy with this. I've not had a personal device like this and to be honest, I'm still not entirely certain that I am holding my arm/hand in the right place for it to be accurate. Next time I go to the doctor's office I will bring it with and maybe they can help me. The other thing I'm not sure of is when I am done with it, how do i turn it off properly? there's an on/off button and I think I'm turning it off, but... there's still something showing on the display. Huh.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like that this device transmits all of my readings (via Bluetooth) to my iPhone. I found what works best for me is if I lay down on my back and place my wrist above my chest I get the most accurate readings!
customer_reviews.author: Joe T.

customer_reviews.title: Readings are not accurate
customer_reviews.text: We have an older Series 7 wrist monitor that we've used for years and had correlated at the doctor's office. We trust the readings on that one. The readings on the new one are all over the place, and, for me at least, 10-20 points low. Your arm and body position are crucial to getting a reading that is even close. If anything is off even a little, you can't depend on the reading. I would not recommend this model, although I still like Omron. Perhaps look at one of their other models.
customer_reviews.author: GeneK

customer_reviews.title: No backlight, inaccurate results
customer_reviews.text: Backlight inadeqate or did not work. Impossible to read screen. Also B/P runs high and no cues to position arm correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor but...
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor but the lack of back light on the unit was a deal breaker. Reading my blood pressure in the mornings and night by my bed it was difficult to see the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: justshady

customer_reviews.title: Reads low, uncomfortable position
customer_reviews.text: Had an older Omron wrist BP meter that I used successfully for many years and it finally died so I bought this new one. You have to sit with your elbow on a table and it hurts your elbow, and you have to hold your wrist turned up. But the real problem is the accuracy, it is reading VERY low. I'm getting readings as low as 111/69 and then my daughter who is a nurse takes my BP with a manual cuff and gets 132/89. Wish I could return it but I threw away the box!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This BP monitor works well when it works. I have a series 7 BP652N which is supposed to be very close to the same thing for $100 less. Well, you get what you pay for. This monitor seems finicky about getting a accurate BP reading right away. Usually have to try a few times which messes with the accuracy. If you're serious about an accurate BP reading then I suggest the BP652N hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Ldiddy

customer_reviews.title: Caution if you need accuracy or easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Wanting an upgrade for a home BP cuff from what I had, I was intrigued by new model wrist cuffs. I read that these are not clinically recommended, except in certain circumstances, as they tend to be less accurate than upper arm cuffs, even with careful adherence to manufacturer instructions. I have found this to be the case with this product. In addition, I found the initial set up to be difficult to follow, despite normally having no difficulties with new device set ups.
customer_reviews.author: Butch28

customer_reviews.title: The bottom number was always off by 20
customer_reviews.text: Well, the bottom number was always off by 19 or 20 regardless of what I did to make it work correctly. I think that says it all.
customer_reviews.author: edtech4genz

customer_reviews.title: So easy and so quick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Grampa because even the extra large cuffs for upper arm still pinch him horribly! This one doesn't cause him pain. It is a breeze to use, and accurate! The display is large. Would be nice if it was back lit for easier reading in darker room.
customer_reviews.author: Lmj

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and accurate readings!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and accurate readings. I have very large upper arms, nothing fits, so I tried this wrist model and it is amazing. Indicates when your wrist is at heart level and is super quick. Also has Bluetooth so I just transfer readings to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Zax

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the Omron wrist BP monitor is very easy to use! Just had my BP taken at my doctors office and the Reading that I get with the wrist monitor appears to be very accurate. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Wireless data loading yo App
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and I really like the wireless feature.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fagan

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate readings
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate measurement, two subsequent measurements can be dramatically different .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Omron 7
customer_reviews.text: Nice meter. Instructions are terrible. The instructions for pairing were just wrong. The pairing with Alexa none existent. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fried Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Hard To See
customer_reviews.text: Works good, Very quite. Easy to Use...That said, it would have gotten 5 stars if the background lit up. Very hard to see the numbers ...
customer_reviews.author: Gail Egburtson

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Wife has fibromyalgia and arm cuffs are very painful for her. This works great and is a lot less painful for her.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Summerfield

customer_reviews.title: accuracy is almost great when comared to arm cuff
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with this Omron it does not have indicator light that machine is placed at exact the heart level Compared to upper arm cuff monitor both are resulting similar reading within 5 points difference
customer_reviews.author: Ray A. Ghougassian

customer_reviews.title: Easy Blood Pressure
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. It's so easy to use and so accurate. I'm going to take this with me the next time I go to the doctor to show my results when they get their "white coat syndrome" reading with their arm cuff!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Foster

customer_reviews.title: OMRON Series 7 Wrist Cuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great but might not be exactly accurate but I use it when I travel. Great hard case for traveling around.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: It's very convenient to use but not as accurate as a cuff unit. Still it's more than adequate to get good daily readings.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M

product_meta.title: Omron 7 Series Wireless Wrist Blood Pressure Monitor, Black
product_meta.description: The Omron 7 Series Wireless wrist monitor also automatically averages up to your last 3 readings over a period of 10 minutes for a more accurate picture of your heart's health. This wrist blood pressure monitor stores up to 90 readings for 1 user in the monitor, or unlimited readings when used with the Omron Connect app, allowing you to keep a comprehensive recording of your readings over time and monitor any fluctuations in your readings. The app also lets you view your trend graphs and charts, and share as needed with your family, caregivers, or physicians. The Omron Connect app works with iOS and Android devices (with select iOS and Android devices
feature_bullets: Manage/track up to 90 readings on your monitor and unlimited readings and users on your smartphone with the free Omron app; Fits adult wrists ranging from 5.3" to 8.5" in circumference, and also detects irregular heartbeats

Omron exclusives: Cuff Wrap Guide to alert you if the cuff is wrapped too loosely; Heart Zone Guidance activates inflation when your wrist is at heart level; Hypertension Indicator alerts you if systolic/diastolic measurements are above normal range
Bluetooth connectivity with the FREE Omron Connect app (on select iOS & Android devices) stores unlimited readings and users; works with Amazon Alexa enabled devices using the Omron Health skill

Omron is the #1 recommended home blood pressure monitor brand by doctors and pharmacists for clinically accurate home monitoring, and the #1 selling manufacturer of home blood pressure monitors for over 40 years
Note: Blood pressure varies constantly due to many factors including stress, time of day, and how you wrap the cuff, may affect your blood pressure
